Module Simulator
Package kin.env.obstacles

Class Obstacle

java.lang.Object
kin.env.obstacles.Obstacle
Direct Known Subclasses:
PolyhedricObstacle, SphericalObstacle
public abstract class Obstacle
extends java.lang.Object
Any obstacle. The most simple pattern is a 2D ground shape, extruded in z-direction.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

      Get the 3D center of gravity.
      Returns:
      array of 3 with x, y, z

    • nearestPoint3D

      public abstract double[][][] nearestPoint3D​(double cx, double cy, double cz)

      Get the nearest obstacle's surface point (border, or top) to a given point. The distance is measured in 3D. The distance is measured to the border, even if the given point is inside the obstacle.

      Parameters:
      cx - given point (x)
      cy - given point (y)
      cz - given point (z)
      Returns:
      array with 3 elements [0]: collision, [1]: normal(s), [2] additional velocity. In details
      • [0][0]: nearest point x, y, z;
      • [1][0], [1][0]-[1][1] or [1][0]-[1][2]: surface unit normals that point to free space;
      • [2]==null or [2][0]: additional velocity in cm per ArmBot.SIMULATION_TICK_DELTA.

    • moveOutObstacle

      public abstract java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> moveOutObstacle​(PolyhedricObstacle obstacle)
      Compute, how to move the given obstacle (usually a Cuboid out of this ostacle.
      Parameters:
      obstacle - the other polyhedric obstacle to move out
      Returns:
      list of deepest points, each of it: [0] deepest point, [1] direction vector to move the point out, [2] null or additional velocity in per ArmBot.SIMULATION_TICK_DELTA. Entire result may be null for no intersection.

    • getDebugName

      public java.lang.String getDebugName()
      Get the debug name.
      Returns:
      debug name

    • setDebugName

      public void setDebugName​(java.lang.String debugName)
      Set the debug name.
      Parameters:
      debugName - debug name
